snippet: Gov. Rick Snyder has agreed to be questioned by union lawyers about his decision to let Detroit file for bankruptcy protection, state lawyers said.
abstract: Michigan Gov Rick Snyder agrees to be questioned by union lawyers about his decision to allow Detroit to file for bankruptcy protection; lawyers for Snyder and other state officials have been resisting deposition, based on executive privilege.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Rick Snyder has agreed to be questioned by union lawyers about his decision to let Detroit file for bankruptcy protection, state lawyers said.

keywords.value: American Federation of State, County and Municipal Employees
keywords.name: organizations
